abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column highlights start-up Slack as best example of communication system that has potential to rival, and possibly supplant, reliance on email, particularly in workplaces; isolates certain features that reflect co-founder Stewart Butterfield's vision of office, such as way majority of communications are visible to everyone in a company, to enhance collaboration and transparency.
lead_paragraph: The start-up Slack is changing the way workers communicate, with a group chat app that eschews privacy and automatically archives almost everything.

headline.main: Slack, the Office Messaging App That May Finally Sink Email
headline.print_headline: An Office Messaging App That May Finally Sink Email

snippet: The start-up Slack is changing the way workers communicate, with a group chat app that eschews privacy and automatically archives almost everything.
